com.zpaper.authentication

Class SFSessionFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zpaper.authentication.SFSessionFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter

    @WebFilter(value="/*")
public class SFSessionFilter
extends Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter
    The purpose of this Filter is to ensure that SF sessionIds that have been logged out invalidate the zPaper session. The initial request for a session is used to query salesforce for the current sessionId status via a REST request. If the status is 403 "Bad_Outh_Token" then a 403 is returned in the response and the current zPaper session(JESSIONID) is invalidated. To limit the frequency of querying salesforce for connection status, the response is cached in the session object. Each HttpRequest that finds a valid sfSessionId causes the expiry of the cached object to be extended. The intent of this approach is to minimize the expiration time thereby effectively reduce the window between salesforce logout and zpaper logout. The assumption is that all requests from a page will arrive within the expiry time therefore only one validation request is required per page.
